schoolediuinitie dissent though bée shew sophocles poet writer tragedy asked ofhis frend whē brought person ofwomen made alwaies good whereas euripides made badde quoth doo represent woman euripides matter fareth betweene canus dooth paint schoolemen speake peruerting scripture haue prophaned diuinitie philosophie rather sophistrie yet called schoolediuines whē neither schollers truth diuines accoūteth none schoolediuine locor theolog lib 8 cap 1 reasoneth god thinges concernyng god fitly wisely learnedly holie scripture ordinance god none schoolediuine diuinitie schoolediuinitie quae doth concerne point proofe whereof cited namely paule went see peter reuerent respect honor person deny argument inferre thereof peter therefore singular power whereby meane supremacie haue laid father would néedes bestow denied graunted world men rather giue rich need poore need hart thought would rather haue denied cléere selfe néedeth proofe common vse men sheweth giue honor reuerence acknowledge superioritie▪ rainoldes perhaps superioritie yet supremacie hart peter paules superior power supremacie proued rainoldes power say somewhat though neuerthelesse might full hie power yet come short supremacie superior thing el power hart superior power proue peter honor giuen paule therefore power aboue rainoldes euill newes husbandes haue shrewes wiues argument good 1 pet 37 commaunded giue honor woman weaker vessell whereof logicke wiues may claime authoritie power aboue husbandes peter saw consequence thinke supremacie although teach husband giue honor wife yet calleth wife weaker vessell stronger 1 pet 31 commandeth wiues subiect husband inferior trow power vnto 1 cor 1110 paule noteth also expressely saith woman ought haue power vpon head hart answere doth weaken cannot erre magistrate prince prince hart prince rainoldes prince physician common wealth physician erre physician erreth misseth arte wherefore want physicke erreth physicke speake exactly artificer erre least cannot erre artificer erreth erreth hath skill enough hath skill hart yet artificer may erre practise arte physician curing sicke men prince ruling common wealth therefore thinketh shift quidditie artificer may iustly saide erre artificer doth erre dealeth respect arte least erre therein artificer erreth euill artificer rainoldes true euill artificer hart man plato must amend spéech say prince may erre euil prince though cannot good magistrate euill magistrate rainoldes physician must amend say physician cure sicke wel doth erre euill physician hart must rainoldes likewise lieutenant slew two put eye third reason vprore tumult ensuing part countrie rebelled conquered king lombardie rome dominion roman dukedome fell vnto pope pope till time béene bishop onely yeare christ 727 became prince treason emperour sent another deputie italie stay attemptes entring league king lombard ioined hostes togither besieged rome pope perceiuing garrison munition wherewith fensed ecclesiae • eous succurre • et helpe church lombard charles embassage raised siege charles dyed sonne named pipine suc • ceded office chilperike king part kingly duty left charge burden thereof vnto tooke thereby occasion make himselfe king bring greater credit autoritie pope aduise asked pope zacharie made answere execute dutie king ought king rather execute whereupon french men chose pipine tremble mention cockatrice venemous mouth hath said hath said nay hath written hath writen penne iron hath writen last monument sclaunder thinke verily saluation none religion indeede religion false sclaunderous spéeches church wherewith hath besette worke sundry place precious stone vnderlaide reason church faith begotten father sister germaine sclaunders loose dull truth yet apparance sharpe sound although skilfull might crush péeces without harme yet might doo harme stinging vnskilfull euen scorpion sting man dooth hurt sting bruse straight body brused anoint part stoong dooth hurt wherefore intent scorpion bristow pricking two sting worst kind scorpion wont one sclaunders cauilles might doo hurt men vniuersities part realme thought haue stoong many godly men haue wished brused part yet least many grace god healeth would recure might therewith anointed doo séeme haue wished much men hauing litle skill physiche doo thinke scorpion stinging uncurable bristow himselfe thraso heale wounded know gnatho hath cast abroad late infamous verse vniuersitie hath insolently boasted sclaunderous libell scatered oxford 1577 captaines tremble amazed bristowes lightning though astonied coronells army souldiers onely let bristow know nether doo feare howsoeuer hath touched youthes pasquines poore men haue cause stand doute though threaten armed leauer dishclout wil quel stand way crush thē peeces parasite ye pope think lightning hath •• asht burn england sure lightning virgil acn • id lib 6 poet lightning salmoneus shaking oft torch counterfeit thundring soundes lightning flame heauen kindes lightning although daunt wauering gréekes towne elis whose king salmoneus yet daunt vnuincible christian citie liuing god whose king lord let flasht take héed bee wise least foolish lightning apoll odor de orig deor lib 1 say happened lightner salmoneus reuenged true lightning almightie god vtter ruine selfe towne citizen church ioh 1613 lead holy ghost truth hath béene alreadie taught scripture shall taught farther grace god difference betweene lightning bristow light iesus christ lightning bristow heate whereof doth hurt body striketh light iesus christ beames whereof delite men shineth lightning euill pestilent blindeth sée killeth liue light good healthfull giueth sight vnto blinde life vnto dead neither wee without many godly men excellent autoritie haue disdained childe yet purposed set vpon name lord hostes god host israel prepared selfe battaile chosen smooth stone brooke god worde 2 cor 104 mightie god cast downe holdes euery high thing christian concealing name set foorth booke touching autoritie god word 〈◊〉 church demaund 34 bristow willeth set booke put name approbation rabbines priuilege promiseth shal quickly see answered booke haue sought could fall vpon copy ghesse sold neither knew speake autor cōcealed name dout good cause satisfie wholy yet farre might chalēge bristow haue set litle treatise point ye autours name thereto approbation rabbines leaue synagogue whose matt 2 • 7 ruler loue called rabbi rabbi maisters doctours graue learned men concerneth thing hope like much better compriseth onely question touching scripture church desireth set certaine also kinde chiefly touching church whereof hath onely bare name boast looke answere much sooner fower yeares past since title booke demaundes promised latin booke whether come abroad already come shortly may ioine please answere conclusion wherein thinke méete deale thrée thing easy doon reasonable iudgement request one set downe text conclusion wholy answere determined doo demaundes reader may sée confuteth kicke prickes yéelde truth go darken cléere light sunne righteousnes cauils sclanders thirde ashamed say truth preuails yet reprouing thing assayeth reproue deale soundly sincerely stapleton hath doon doctrinall principle faith worke full wordes truth confute doctrine princ fid doctr lib 1 cap 4 church company god elect chosen teach catholike church true teacheth cap 5 euill men mingled church good reprobate elect thing also true militant church true thinges agrée true thinges ne •• doth one truth ouerthrow hold▪ catholike church commended v creede whole company god elect chosen answereth militant church mentioned scripture containeth neither elect onely answere saith hath confuted errour heresie calleth v iohn husse godly man holy martyr taught concerning church hussite therein dealeth like prouerbe asked hooke say haue mattokes returne purpose haue thought good publish conclusion euen sort set downe verse opened
